IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: COLUMBIA ACADEMY IS COMMITTED TO SERVING IT'S STUDENTS SO THEY MASTER SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, AND CHARACTER APPROPRIATE FOR THEM AND THEIR FUTURE WHILE BECOMING CHRIST-LIKE IN ATTITUDE AND BEHAVIOR.
IRS990.MissionDesc: COLUMBIA ACADEMY IS COMMITTED TO SERVING IT'S STUDENTS SO THEY MASTER SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, AND CHARACTER APPROPRIATE FOR THEM AND THEIR FUTURE WHILE BECOMING CHRIST-LIKE IN ATTITUDE AND BEHAVIOR.
IRS990.Desc: GRADES PRE-K-12: PROVIDE PRIMARY AND SECONDARY EDUCATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PART X, LINE 2: COLUMBIA ACADEMY, INC. AND THE FOUNDATION ARE BOTH EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 501(C)(3), AND, ACCORDINGLY, NO PROVISION FOR INCOME TAXES IS INCLUDED IN THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. A TAX POSITION IS RECOGNIZED AS A BENEFIT ONLY IF IT IS "MORE LIKELY THAN NOT" THE TAX POSITION WOULD BE SUSTAINED IN A TAX EXAMINATION, WITH A TAX EXAMINATION BEING PRESUMED TO OCCUR. THE AMOUNT RECOGNIZED IS THE AMOUNT OF TAX BENEFIT GREATER THAN 50% LIKELY OF BEING REALIZED ON EXAMINATION. FOR TAX POSITIONS NOT MEETING THE "MORE LIKELY THAN NOT" TEST, NO TAX BENEFIT IS RECORDED. AS OF MAY 31, 2023, THE ACADEMY HAS ACCRUED NO INTEREST AND NO PENALTIES RELATED TO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. IT IS THE ACADEMY'S POLICY TO RECOGNIZE INTEREST AND/OR PENALTIES RELATED TO INCOME TAX MATTERS IN INCOME TAX EXPENSE. COLUMBIA ACADEMY, INC. AND THE FOUNDATION EACH FILE A U.S. FEDERAL INFORMATION TAX RETURN.
REVENUE ATTRIBUTABLE TO THE FOUNDATION ON A CONSOLIDATED AFS 13,683. ROUNDING 1.
GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS NETTED WITH REVENUE 124,750.
GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS NETTED WITH REVENUE 124,750.

A STATEMENT REGARDING THE ACADEMY'S NON-DISCRIMINATION POLICY IS WRITTEN IN THE STUDENT HANDBOOK AND ON ENROLLMENT/APPLICATION FORMS. IT IS ALSO PUBLISHED IN THE ANNUAL PUBLICATION, "THE COMMUNICATOR".

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE G, PART I, LINE 2B, COLUMN (V)
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PAYMENT FOR THE PROFESSIONAL CONSULTING SERVICE FOR THE ORGANIZATION'S CAPITAL CAMPAIGN

APPLICANTS COMPLETE AN ONLINE APPLICATION WITH FACTS GRANT & AID (FACTS). FACTS ASSISTS THE SCHOOL IN SUMMARIZING AND ANALYZING THE INFORMTION. THE FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE AT COLUMBIA ACADEMY USES THIS INFORMATION TO DETERMINE AWARDS. ALL AWARDS ARE APPLIED AS TUITION CREDITS AND CANNOT BE REFUNDED; HENCE, THERE IS NO EXCHANGE OF FUNDS.

OCCASIONALLY THE SCHOOL WILL RECEIVE GIFTS OF PUBLICLY TRADED STOCK. THE SCHOOL'S POLICY IS TO IMMEDIATELY LIQUIDATE STOCK GIFTS. R.W. BAIRD, WHO HANDLES THE SCHOOL'S ENDOWMENT ACCOUNTS, WILL SELL THE STOCK AND DISTRIBUTE THE PROCEEDS TO THE SCHOOL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS REVIEWS THE FORM 990 PRIOR TO FILING AND PROVIDES ANY FEEDBACK TO THE CFO.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PRESIDENT, CFO, AND BUSINESS MANAGER ARE INFORMED OF ALL EMPLOYEMENT HIRING DECISIONS AS WELL AS NEW VENDOR CONTRACTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS DETERMINES THE COMPENSATION FOR THE PRESIDENT. THE PRESIDENT HAS FNIAL AUTHORITY OVER THE COMPENSATION OF ALL OTHER EMPLOYEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE DOCUMENTS ARE NOT MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.
